steps.title: Click the Start logo.
steps.content: Click the Start logo. You can also press the Windows key.

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. You'll see this gear icon in the left-most panel of the expanded Start menu. Alternatively, press the key combo Win + I (that's an Uppercase "i").

steps.title: Click Update & Security.
steps.content: Click Update & Security . It's next to a large refresh icon.

steps.title: Click Check for Updates.
steps.content: Click Check for Updates . If Windows Update finds an updated installed printer driver, it will automatically download and install it. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Alternatively, click View optional Updates and then click the arrow next to "Driver Updates" to see a list of installed drivers that you can update. When you find your printer's driver (if it's already installed), click it to select it and click Download and Install .

steps.title: Open "Printers & Scanners.
steps.content: Open "Printers & Scanners. " You can get here by clicking the Apple logo, then going to System Preferences > Printers & Scanners .

steps.title: Click to select your printer in the list.
steps.content: Click to select your printer in the list. If it's not in the list, use the method for downloading installers from the printer manufacturer's website. If you clicked to select your printer, you should see its details in the panel on the right side of the window.

steps.title: Click -.
steps.content: Click - . It's the Remove button and will remove your printer from the list.

steps.title: Click +.
steps.content: Click + . This is the Add button. If you're prompted, select Add Printer or Scanner . You should see the IPs, Shared, and Open Directory printers on your network as well as the one you're trying to install. However, this list may take a few minutes to populate.

steps.title: Click to select your printer from the list.
steps.content: Click to select your printer from the list. If it doesn't appear, make sure it's connected to a power source and is on.

steps.title: Click an option.
steps.content: Click an option. You can use: AirPrint if it's offered (you won't need any cables), printer software installed on your Mac or downloaded from Apple (the prompt will direct you to download available printer software) or printer software from a file on your Mac (which doesn't apply if you don't have the printer software already installed).

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions to download your printer software.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions to download your printer software. On macOS, printer drivers aren't known as "drivers" but as "printer software" instead. You'll want to download the recommended software to be able to use your printer. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Go to your printer manufacturer's support website.
steps.content: Go to your printer manufacturer's support website. You can find this easily enough by using "[printer name] support" in the search field of a search engine.

steps.title: Search for your specific printer.
steps.content: Search for your specific printer. You can either browse the "Drivers" section of the website or, if it's available, search by your printer model.

steps.title: Download the driver.
steps.content: Download the driver. You'll click a Download button or the driver name to be prompted to save the file.

steps.title: Double-click the downloaded file.
steps.content: Double-click the downloaded file. Most drivers are self-installing, but you need to open the file to prompt it to self-install.
